description.narrative: In 2008 Zambia Federation of Disability Organisations (ZAFOD) with the support of Irish Aid through Power4Good Ireland launched a three years project called Advancing Disability Equality Project (ADEPt) whose aim is to set legal precedents in the violation of the rights of persons with disabilities. During this period a large number of high profile legal cases on accessibility to public buildings / institutions, employment rights violations and social exclusion issues were handled. In its three year tenure the project focussed on handling rights violation matters from within Lusaka Province. Subsequent to this funding was secured by the ADEPt Senior team from the Finnish Embassy to extend the life of the project for a further one year from September 2010 and vitally to expand the service being provided to Western and Northern Provinces by the attachment of qualified Caseworkers to ZAFOD Offices in these Provinces and the establishment of appropriate referral mechanisms.The mission of the project is to ensure sustained protection defense and advancement of the human rights and fundamental freedoms of persons with disabilities in Zambia. The purpose is to establish principles and precedents which achieve improved rights of persons with disabilities through capac ity building litigation and publicity. The precedents are notably around key issues/themes of i) access ii) education iii) employment iv) women and children v) electoral process vi) health and vii) HIV /Aids. Activities include: 1) Casework support and out reach 2) individual litigation 3) strategic litigation (public interest litigation) 4) accessibility audits and 5) advocacy and awareness raising. Special emphasis will be given to women and children with disabilities. A template for replication of project design will be done during the period and roll out to Zimbabwe Malawi and Mozambique is expected.
